text: how much do you know about your blood
well in this video i'm gonna share seven
fun and very interesting facts you
probably didn't know so let's do it
[Music]
[Applause]
let's start with fact number one did you
know that every second the body makes
somewhere between two and three million
red blood cells that's a whole lot of
cells but the reality is the demand for
oxygen throughout the body is so high
that these cells are needed in very high
numbers there are around 5 million blood
cells in a microliter of blood so our
bone marrow has a huge job to do let's
go with fact number two an adult body
has 60 000 miles of blood vessels
running throughout the entire body or
depending on where you are in the world
that would be a hundred thousand
kilometers now just to give a little bit
of context the circumference of the
earth at the equator is less than 25 000
miles so if you were to line all of your
blood vessels up it would wrap around
the earth almost two and a half times
that's mind-blowing okay let's go with
fact number three when blood leaves your
heart it goes on a journey through the
body well it takes about a minute 60
seconds for that blood that leaves your
heart to go through the entire body and
get back to the heart now obviously this
is an average but it can actually go
much faster think about it when you're
exercising your heart rate increases so
that 60 seconds can be knocked down
pretty quick but it's a pretty accurate
average all right fact number four you
know about the blood grouping system
well the most common blood type in the
united states is o positive coming in at
around 39 of the population and the
least common type is a b negative with
only 0.5 percent of the population if
you want to learn more about blood types
and how that all works check out our
video on that topic and while we're on
the topic of blood types let's go right
to fact number five as i mentioned yes
we have the grouping system well
that's actually very simplified based on
the most common blood types which would
be the types a type b
a b and o but did you know there are
actually around 30 different recognized
blood types though we're familiar with
the common types like a b a b and o
which is a part of the simplified
system there are actually over 30
different recognized blood groups we
have the mns system lutheran kelly kid
and other grouping systems but while
there are all these different types of
blood the well-established grouping
system is the main one used and has a
lot of significance especially when it
comes to things like blood transfusions
and while we're talking about blood
transfusions let's chat a bit about fact
number six which is related to blood
donation did you know that when you
donate blood the red blood cells can be
stored for up to 42 days while your
platelets can only be stored for five
days and on the other end donated blood
plasma can be stored for up to a year
but it has to be frozen to last that
long and for our last fun fact about
blood did you know that there's one body
part that doesn't use blood at all yep
that part is your cornea in your eye and
that's because it doesn't need blood it
can actually get oxygen directly from
the air no blood needed as for
everywhere else well you're gonna need
some blood so there we have it seven
facts about the blood but i'm curious
did you know any of these facts before
watching this video if so drop a comment
and let me know which ones you knew and
this video is a different format from
how we normally do it what do you think
do you want me to make more fun fact
videos i'd love to hear from you lastly
i want to give a shout out to our
patrons who are supporting what we do
here at interactive biology thank you
shannon sloves fatty mcgee mark mason
and yuri herder for your support of
interactive biology if you'd like to
support us and get some really cool
benefits like downloadable versions of
our videos audio versions that you can
listen to on the go slides handouts
study guides and more check us out on
patreon i'll leave a link to that in the
description below that's all for now
peace
